message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the physics of motion. As the car approaches a hill, it will become harder to push because the force of gravity is acting against the motion of the car. Option (A) is incorrect because steering is not affected by the incline of the road. Option (B) is unrelated to the question because parking is not affected by the incline of the road. Option (D) is also unrelated to the question because braking is not affected by the incline of the road.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the physics of movement and the effects of gravity. As the car approaches a hill and starts to ascend, it will become harder to push because the car is working against the force of gravity pulling it downward. Option (A) is incorrect because steering does not become harder when approaching a hill. Option (B) is unrelated to the question and not affected by the hill. Option (D) is also unrelated as the difficulty of braking would depend on the slope of the hill and the speed of the car, but not inherently related to approaching a hill.

This question requires understanding of the physics of motion and the effect of slopes on vehicles. As the car approaches a hill, it will become harder to push because there is an increase in resistance due to gravity pulling the car downhill. Option (A) is incorrect because steering is not affected by the slope of the road. Option (B) is unrelated to the physics of approaching a hill. Option (D) is also unrelated because the braking system of a car is not affected by the slope of the road.

This question requires a basic understanding of how a car's motion is affected when it approaches a hill. As the car approaches a hill, the gradient of the road increases, which means that there is an upward slope. This makes it harder to push the car because the force required to overcome the gravitational pull and move uphill increases. Option (A) is incorrect because steering is not affected by the gradient of the road. Option (B) is unrelated to the motion of the car when approaching a hill. Option (D) is also unrelated because braking is not affected by the gradient of the road, but rather by the need to slow down or stop the car.
